concise_definition: n. 吞咽, 吞下; v. 吞咽 (swallow 的现在分词/动名词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: The act of passing food, liquid, or other substances from the mouth through the esophagus into the stomach, typically as part of the digestive process.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将食物、液体或其他物质从口腔通过食道送入胃部的动作，通常是消化过程的一部分。
definitions.example_en: He had difficulty with swallowing after the surgery.

definitions.explanation_en: A single act of swallowing; the amount of something taken in at one time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一次吞咽的动作；一次吞下的量。
definitions.example_en: She took a small swallowing of water before speaking.
definitions.example_cn: 她说话前喝了一小口水。

definitions.explanation_en: To pass food, liquid, or an object from the mouth down the throat and into the stomach involuntarily or deliberately.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指无意识或有意识地将食物、液体或物体从口腔经咽喉送入胃中。
definitions.example_en: The child was afraid of swallowing the pill.

definitions.explanation_en: To accept or believe something, especially something unpleasant or unbelievable, without protest or question.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指接受或相信某事，尤其是不愉快或难以置信的事，而不提出异议或质疑。
definitions.example_en: They tried to make us swallow the lie as if it were truth.
definitions.example_cn: 他们试图让我们相信这个谎言，就像它是真理一样。

comparison.analysis: “Ingest” (摄入) 是一个更正式、更广泛的术语，泛指通过口腔或其他途径将物质引入体内，包括吸入、注射等，不限于吞咽动作。而 “swallowing” 专指通过咽喉将物质送入胃部的生理过程，范围更窄、更具体。
“Gulping” (大口吞咽) 强调快速、大量、有时是粗鲁或急切地吞咽，带有情绪或动作上的强烈色彩。而 “swallowing” 是中性词，仅描述动作本身，不包含速度或情绪的暗示。
“Devour” (狼吞虎咽) 通常用于描述进食时的贪婪或急切状态，强调速度和欲望，常用于比喻（如 devour a book）。它侧重于进食行为的强烈性，而 “swallowing” 仅指物理上的吞咽动作，不涉及情感或动机。
